post: Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Brianna Blair! Brianna is a high school junior from Goodyear, Arizona. She is very excited to be a BRI Student Fellow! With a passion for civic education, she believes in increasing representation in government and politics. She founded a youth organization, HerGov, to increase the number of young women entering the public policy sphere. Learn more about BRI's Student Fellowship!  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h

Interested in learning about our approach to teaching civics? Chief Program Officer Stan Swim explores how we seek to teach it in a way that is effective, unique, and relevant to students and educators today. Instead of focusing solely on the structure and function of government, BRI teaches young people to engage in the institutions of civil society, like businesses, charities, and community groups, to solve problems and pursue opportunities. Watch the video today!  https://lnkd.in/e8CMY-jj

Today, June 6, marks the anniversary of Allied forces landing in Northern France, beginning what they hoped would bring about the destruction of the German war machine, the elimination of Nazi tyranny over the oppressed peoples of Europe....  Dwight D. Eisenhower was the Supreme Commander of Allied forces. In preparation for the invasion, he crafted a statement for the general public in the event the landings failed. Explore this lesson and learn about how Eisenhower's actions exemplified the civic virtue of responsibility in leading the Allied forces.  https://bit.ly/4mEeoMR

Are you planning summer travel? Did you know you can support BRI while you travel? Through our partnership with  https://bit.ly/4jtFt2v, every travel purchase you make can help support our civic mission. Book your new flight, rental car, or hotel stay through our website and give back to the Institute!  https://bit.ly/43XWUUk

In this recent episode of Moreland University Front of the Class, BRI's Senior Director of Civic Learning Initiatives, Rachel Davison Humphries shares how she came to embrace the concept of direct assistance  which eventually led her to enter education. She discusses teaching at Montessori schools, developing curricula in Guatemala, and helping students internalize the importance of civics through he position at the Bill of Rights Institute. Her story will connect with career changers and career teachers alike as she recounts transformative moments and highlights the importance of agency-driven education. Watch or listen today!  https://bit.ly/458g2QM

Join us in empowering educators with Pocket Constitutions. These compact, comprehensive guides are essential tools for illuminating the foundations of our democracy to our future leaders. Fund a local classroom through our newest campaign and help us equip teachers with this important resource. Our mission is to cultivate informed, engaged citizens for tomorrow, today. Support a Civics Champion near you!  https://lnkd.in/e9WsnNWF

Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Peter Kennedy! Peter is a senior at B. Reed Henderson High School in West Chester, Pennsylvania. He is passionate about government, history, economics, philosophy, and civic engagement. As a second-year BRI Student Fellow, he hopes to continue having great discussions about American government and society. Outside of school, he enjoys swimming, reading, writing, and exploring the outdoors. Learn more about BRI's Student Fellowship!  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h

Service comes in many forms. In our latest Honoring Service episode, Jeremy Dobos, a former Army intelligence officer and President & CEO of Master Printing + Mailing, sits down with BRI's Gerald Gangaram, to reflect on the significance of taking the oath to defend the U. S. Constitution, which he describes as the framework for everything we have thats good in this country. " Dobos encourages young people to get involved in their communities through volunteering and charitable work. Watch the interview here.  https://lnkd.in/e3zXu8NW At The Bill of Rights Institute, we believe in fostering active citizenship. How are you serving your community today?  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #CivicEngagement

Federal Flags, LLC makes all-American-made flags and flag poles. Any purchase made on their site using the code 'BRI' at checkout supports the civic mission of the Bill of Rights Institute. They sell American flags, state flags, military flags, and much more. Find the perfect flag or flagpole for your space and support BRI today!  https://lnkd.in/eiWhveG2

America needs a Sputnik moment for civics. In his new op-ed in The Fulcrum, BRI President and CEO David Bobb discusses the vital soft skills young people develop in civics classes – and why employers are valuing those skills more than ever. As one North Carolina teacher told us, civics is a course in critical thinking and analysis, understanding various perspectives, and expanding beyond ones own thoughts.  See why its time to start viewing civics through a career-readiness framework.  https://bit.ly/4khHOPv
